member.name: M:NHibernate.Burrow.IConversation.SpanWithCookie(System.String)
member.summary: Span with Http Session
member.remarks: The conversation will be available to all requests that shares the same HttpSession

member.name: M:NHibernate.Burrow.IConversation.SpanWithPostBacks
member.summary: Span with a chain of post http requests

member.name: M:NHibernate.Burrow.IConversation.GiveUp
member.summary: Give up the data change made in this conversation
member.remarks: This won't imediately close the conversation, it tells the conversation not to commit the DB change when it is closed.

member.name: M:NHibernate.Burrow.IConversation.FinishSpan
member.summary: tells the conversation to stop spanning itself and commit the data change made in it when it's closed
member.remarks: call this method when all operations in a long span conversation are successfully done

member.name: P:NHibernate.Burrow.IConversation.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique id of this conversation

member.name: P:NHibernate.Burrow.IConversation.IsSpanning
member.summary: Gets if this conversation is Spanning (either with Postbacks or HttpSessions)

member.name: P:NHibernate.Burrow.IConversation.SafeItems
member.summary: Gets the safe data bag the conversation holds
member.remarks: You can use this item to store conversation span data. It's safer as it requires you to use a GUID as key. Basically this is a dictionary that uses guid as keys. Another more convenient and better way to safely store datathat share the same life span as conversation is the

member.name: P:NHibernate.Burrow.IConversation.Items
member.summary: Gets the data bag the conversation holds. You can use this item to store conversation span data.
member.remarks: You can use it as how you want. As it's using string as key, you might have key conflict problem, for safer conversational bag, you can use SafeItems

member.name: P:NHibernate.Burrow.IConversation.WorkSpaceName
member.summary: Gets the string WorkSpace name,
member.remarks: the workSpaceName define the group of pages/handlers within which it spans, if not null or empty, the conversation will span within the pages/handlers with the same workSpaceName

member.name: M:NHibernate.Burrow.Util.WebUtil.WrapUrlWithConversationInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Wraps a url with Conversation Information so that conversation can span with Request query
member.remarks: Please deter calling this method as late as possible. And only call it when you are spanning the conversation. If you wrap a url with conversation info and finish or cancel that conversation later in the same request handle, hitting the url will cause a conversationUnavailable error.
member.exception: thrown if called when the current conversation isn't spanning.

member.summary: Facade of Burrow

member.summary: a shotcut to with (false, null, string.Empty) as the parameter

member.name: M:NHibernate.Burrow.BurrowFramework.InitWorkSpace(System.Boolean,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.String)
member.summary: prepare the Burrow environment for the current visit to your Domain Layer
member.param: if there is an existing WorkSpace, ignoreUnclosedWorkSpace = true will close it first. ignoreUnclosedWorkSpace = false will throw an Exception .
the span states that should be used to initialized it, if you are not spanning the conversation, leave it null
member.remarks: This should be called before any NHibernate related operation and actually, for example, in the begining of handling a http request if you are using NHibernate.Burrow.WebUtil's HttpModule, as you should in an Web Application, it will call this for you, you don't need to worry about this.
member.param: the workSpaceName of the current context (usually defined by the handler side)

member.name: M:NHibernate.Burrow.BurrowFramework.InitWorkSpace(System.Guid)
member.summary: Initialize the WorkSpace and join the conversation with

member.name: M:NHibernate.Burrow.BurrowFramework.CloseWorkSpace
member.summary: close the Burrow environment for the current visit to your Domain Layer
member.remarks: This should be called after the current visit to the domainlayer is finished and the time of next visit is unknow, for example, at the very end of handling the http request if you are using NHibernate.Burrow.WebUtil's HttpModule, it will call this for you, you don't need to worry about this.

member.summary: Data will only be available in conversation it is created, outside of the conversation, exception will be thrown if it is accessed

member.name: T:NHibernate.Burrow.ConversationalData`1
member.summary: A Data container for conversational data that needs to have the same life span with a conversation
member.remarks: use it when you need some data to have the same life span as the current conversation. this class does not actually hold a reference to the which is actually stored in Thus can be cheaply serialized and stored. for example, in a Asp.net application, you can put an entity into a ConversationalData(entity) and then save the conversationalData instance into the ViewState or HttpSession

member.param: the real data you want this container to hold
member.remarks: The default is

member.summary: Gets and sets the data stored in this container

member.name: M:NHibernate.Burrow.Impl.ConversationImpl.GiveUp
member.summary: Give up the data change made in this conversation and stop spanning

member.name: M:NHibernate.Burrow.Impl.ConversationImpl.FinishSpan
member.summary: tells the conversation to stop spanning itself and commit the data change made in it when it's closed
member.remarks: call this method when all operations in a long span conversation are successfully done
